column4: Hey, I just installed Ubuntu yesterday, and whenever I try to view a movie with Totem, I get an error message about "video output is already in use."  Any ideas?
(And for isolating things like Apache for added security)
Heh
Also, I've (already) forgotton my root password :/   Is there a simple way of resetting it?  Like, how do you boot into single-user mode with GRUB?
just "sudo passwd" will let you reset the root password
although you're not supposed to set a root password in ubuntu
the root password is locked by default.  use "sudo" to run commands as root.  the password is prompts for is your password, not root's
To be honest I don't remember setting the root password during install... I'm just looking at this "37 updates available" thing
Ah, okay
it's likely that you haven't forgotten your root password, but that you never had one to start with.
I see... That's interesting idea, btw, of just using sudo for everything
it means that there's no root password for crackers to brute-force
but on the down side it means that anyone getting access to your user account automatically has root
But they can still brute force a user account, and from their do sudo, right?
from their own sudo?  why?
I mean, if a hacker gets my account password now, they basically have root access, don't they?
yes, that's right
sorry, I was confused by your unconventional spelling of "there".
ah, oops

I imagine it's easier to break into a user account than it is into a root account - users run all kinds of insecure apps, like web browsers, email clients, instant messaging, etc.  any hole in one of those could give someone access - and then it's a simple "sudo" to get root
